Key Match Events: Katua (24') scored the first goal of the match
Kalula (86') scored the second goal of the match
Billiat (34' pen.) scored a penalty for Zimbabwe
Hachiro (88') made a notable appearance for Zimbabwe
Pre-Game Insights: Namibia were forced to move their home games to neighbouring South Africa due to their stadiums not being suitable for World Cup qualifiers
Zimbabwe have had a mixed return to international football since their FIFA ban was lifted last year
The key area Michael Nees will need to address is his side's lack of attacking output
Namibia have called up several players who are currently based in South Africa for this month's qualifiers
Post-Match Reflections: Given that both these sides desperately need a win, and possibly view each other as the most likely route to three points, we could see them throw caution to the wind at points in this match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be played behind closed doors at the request of Namibia
Namibia have beaten Zimbabwe in six straight encounters prior to this one
Zimbabwe have yet to score a goal since Michael Nees' arrival
Others: The Africa Cup of Nations Qualifying match between Namibia and Zimbabwe took place on October 10, 2024, at 2pm UK at the Orlando Stadium in Johannesburg
Namibia's participation in the next edition of the Africa Cup of Nations is in serious jeopardy unless they can turn their form around
